results.name: wordpress-system/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-7dfd594975-29xpk Pod/mysql-7dfd594975-gp85h], expected 2

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the pods are not in a ready state.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs [pod-name]`.
3. Verify pod readiness probes.
4. Ensure network policies allow traffic.
5. Restart pods if necessary.

results.name: wordpress-system/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-564b56c6-xfdg7 Pod/wordpress-564b56c6-7j9d6 Pod/wordpress-564b56c6-lwq2s], expected 3

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the pods are not ready.  
Solution: 1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`. 2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs [pod-name]`. 3. Ensure pods are running and healthy. 4. Verify readiness probes in pod specs. 5. Restart pods if necessary.

results.name: wordpress-system/mysql-7dfd594975-29xpk

error.Text: Liveness probe failed: dial tcp 10.244.1.4:3306: connect: connection refused

results.details:
Error: The Kubernetes liveness probe failed because it couldn't connect to the service at IP 10.244.1.4 on port 3306.

Solution: 
1. Check if the service is running.
2. Verify the service IP and port.
3. Ensure network policies allow traffic.
4. Inspect firewall settings.
5. Review pod logs for more details.

error.Text: Liveness probe failed: dial tcp 10.244.1.6:3306: connect: connection refused

results.details:
Error: The Kubernetes liveness probe failed because it couldn't connect to the service at IP 10.244.1.6 on port 3306.

Solution: 
1. Verify the service is running on the correct IP and port.
2. Check network policies or firewalls blocking the connection.
3. Ensure the pod has the correct permissions.
4. Restart the pod if necessary.

results.name: wordpress-system/wordpress-564b56c6-7j9d6

error.Text: Readiness probe failed: HTTP probe failed with statuscode: 500

results.details:
Error: The readiness probe failed because the application returned a 500 status code, indicating an internal server error.

Solution: 
1. Check application logs for errors.
2. Ensure all dependencies are running.
3. Verify configuration settings.
4. Restart the application.
